snippet: Sigma Alpha Epsilon will no longer force aspiring members to endure onerous tasks of the type that have defined fraternity initiations for more than half a century.
abstract: Sigma Alpha Epsilon, one of nation's largest college fraternities, announces it will no longer permit 'pledging' as part of its initiation process for undergraduates after string of hazing-related injuries and deaths at its houses.

byline.contributor: Matt Hamilton contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Sigma Alpha Epsilon will no longer force aspiring members to endure onerous tasks of the type that have defined fraternity initiations for more than half a century.

headline.main: After Students’ Hazing-Related Deaths, Fraternity Eliminates Tradition of Pledging
headline.print_headline: After Students’ Hazing-Related Deaths, Fraternity Eliminates Tradition of Pledging
